discourse_list.title: Doo_Upcoming Resignation from Maker Growth Core Unit

content.content: It’s bittersweet to share this news as I have been with the Maker team for almost 4 years, and contributed to many successes and mistakes. Thanks to our coordinated efforts (including former Head of Business Development @g_dip , former China Lead @Chao.Pan , former Europe & Asia BD @Gustav_Arentoft , and @rune (especially for crucial Chinese expansions)), Dai and Maker are integrated to various major entities ranging from major exchanges to dApps to high-level corporate experiments in Asia. Awareness and reputation of MakerDAO has increased as well. The landscape in Asia is changing especially due to recently enforced regulations especially in China and Korea. This is both risk and opportunity for MakerDAO to potentially fill the change and expand. I have full confidence that @joce_chang will be able to take such opportunity as well. My resignation from Maker Growth CU is so that I can focus more on delegate work, reduce conflict of interest, and help Growth CU’s budget. I will likely spend days in July to redistribute all of business connections / deals as much as possible. And we are still looking for replacement for me so if you know any good candidates for Growth contributor based in Asia, please ping me, Jocelyn, or Nadia. Thank you Maker Community for everything and expect me to be more active in Maker Governance.

This is both sad and wonderful news. Sad that you will no longer serve Maker in Korea as there can be no doubt about the impact you’ve had on the success there over years. You leave some big shoes to fill. Wonderful because that means you can focus fully on being a delegate. Since you’ve joined I’ve been impressed by your attention to detail and omnipresence on the forum. You must have some kind of record in being the first to comment on posts. It’s also great to see a delegate take personal responsibility in reducing their conflict of interest. Personally I’m looking forward to many interesting debates and to keep working with you for the betterment of the protocol.
I am sure your contributions as a delegate will be amazing, you will be of much value to the governance, I hope you never retire from the Dao completely, the Dao needs more people like you.

Doo, Thank you for your many years of service and impeccable representation of the DAO. We are sad to lose you as a contributor, but happy to gain you as an independent delegate. See you in the Hawk party chat!
Congrats on taking the next step! Let’s go!
Thank you for hard work! The best is yet to come

@Doo_StableLab Big thank you for the hard work over all these years! Asia is not an easy or passive environment when it comes to crypto regulations. Having achieved what you, Jocelyn, Nadia, Gustav and others have is already a huge thing. In the cryptosphere Maker is a known player but it also has fierce and growing regional competition. So thanks a lot for keeping pushing the boundaries. I am sure those that will remain in the team will keep the progress. With @joce_chang & team we’re in good hands! Thank you, Will
